member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.MessageUtility
member.summary: Utility class containing utility methods to read and/or modify messages. It is mainly used to insert(read) query options to(from) the URL or message body of the outgoing(incoming) messages.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.MessageUtility.GetServiceQuery(System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message@)
member.summary: Extracts the service query and original message body from . May create a new message with the original body contents.
member.param: The message to use for deserialization.
member.returns: The extracted service query.
member.remarks: The message passed in will not be disposed. This message belongs to the caller.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.MessageUtility.ReadServiceQuery(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Reads the query options from the given reader and returns the resulting service query. It assumes that the reader is positioned on a stream containing the query options.
member.param: Reader to the stream containing the query options.
member.returns: Extracted service query.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.BinaryTypeUtility.IsTypeBinary(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns whether the is System.Data.Linq.Binary.
member.remarks: We test Binary by Type Name so our client framework assembly can avoid taking an assembly reference to System.Data.Linq. If a type is determined to be binary, that type will be used to check reference equality for all subsequent invocations.
member.returns: Whether the is binary

member.returns: The byte[] form of the binary

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.BinaryTypeUtility.GetBinaryFromByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns the converted to a System.Data.Linq.Binary.
member.returns: The binary form of the bytes

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.TypeUtility.GetElementType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the underlying element type starting from a given type.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.MetaType
member.summary:
Class providing additional "meta" information for a Type.
Consider adding any commonly accessed or computed information about a Type to this class, to improve performance and code factoring.

member.summary: Returns the MetaType for the specified Type. The MetaType should only be accessed AFTER all TypeDescriptors have been registered (i.e. after all DomainServiceDescriptions for services exposing the Type have been initialized).

member.returns: The constructed MetaType.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is a ComplexType.

member.summary: Extension methods for TypeDescriptors

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.TypeDescriptorExtensions.ExplicitAttributes(System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor)
member.summary: Extension method to extract only the explicitly specified attributes from a .
member.remarks: Normal TypeDescriptor semantics are to inherit the attributes of a property's type. This method exists to suppress those inherited attributes.
member.param: The property descriptor whose attributes are needed.
member.returns: A new stripped of any attributes from the property's type.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.TypeDescriptorExtensions.Attributes(System.Type)
member.summary: Extension method to extract attributes from a type taking into account the inheritance type of attributes
member.remarks: Normal TypeDescriptor semantics are to inherit the attributes of a type's base type, regardless of their inheritance type.
member.param: The type whose attributes are needed.
member.returns: A new stripped of any incorrectly inherited attributes from the type.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.TypeDescriptorExtensions.ContainsAttributeType``1(System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection)
member.summary: Checks to see if an attribute collection contains any attributes of the provided type.
member.typeparam: The attribute type to check for
member.returns: True if an attribute of the provided type is contained in the attribute collection.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.DomainServiceWebHttpBehavior.GetServiceQuery(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
This method returns a ServiceQuery for the specified URL and query string.
This method must ensure that the original ordering of the query parts is maintained in the results. We want to do this without doing any custom URL parsing. The approach taken is to use HttpUtility to parse the query string, and from those results we search in the full URL for the relative positioning of those elements.
member.param: The query string portion of the URL
member.returns: The corresponding ServiceQuery

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.PoxBinaryMessageEncodingBindingElement.PoxBinaryMessageEncoder.PoxBinaryBufferedMessage
member.summary: A buffered message created by a .
member.remarks: The Message.CreateMessage overloads do not provide a non-streamed message that is comparable to the messages produced by the WCF framework. This disparity leads to both functional and performance pitfalls. This class is an approximation of a buffered message used by WCF, specifically engineered for PoxBinary (i.e. MessageVersion.None only).

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.PoxBinaryMessageEncodingBindingElement.PoxBinaryMessageEncoder.PoxBinaryBufferedMessageData
member.summary: The message data class that holds shared state between messages, buffers, and messages created from a buffer.
member.remarks: The desktop framework allows callers to keep track of reader lifetimes. With this ability, the state can be ref counted across all users, and the buffer can be returned to its manager when all users release their references. The Silverlight framework does not allow callers to keep track of reader lifetimes. Given this, the buffer is not returned to its manager, but is cleaned up by the GC. Note, without a custom message, we would use messages returned from Message.CreateMessage. These messages cannot reuse buffers.

member.summary: Constructs a .
member.param: The buffer manager from which came.
The encoder producing the message contents.

member.summary: Constructs a .
member.param: The encoder producing the message contents.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.QueryProcessor
member.summary: Class encapsulating query deserialization and operation execution, including result flattening and other processing. Basically this is the bridge between the service layer and the domain layer.

Traverse the result object graph, flattening into a single list. Note that this flattening must maintain relative ordering for the top level elements, since the client might have passed an order expression.
member.typeparam: The root entity Type of the query.
member.param: The list of entities to add to the results.
The root entities. The value can be null if the list of root results is already known.
Map used for the lifetime of the flattening to ensure that each entity is added to the results only once.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.QueryProcessor.RequiresFlattening(System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.DomainServiceDescription,System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a query result of the given type requires flattening.
member.remarks:
This method exists to support a performance optimization to skip graph flattening of a query result when we discover the entity has no included associations. It takes inheritance into account by checking for included associations on the given type as well as all types derived from it.
This method evaluates only once per type and caches the result.
member.param: The to use to examine the entity hierarchy.
member.returns: true if a query result of the given requires flattening.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.QueryProcessor.GetEntityDerivedTypes(System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.DomainServiceDescription,System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the collection of all entity types derived from
member.remarks: When entities are shared, because all DomainServices exposing entityType must expose the same least derived entity, and DomainServiceDescription always caches all KnownTypes, the DomainServiceDescription.EntityTypes property exposes the same set of derived types regardless of which DomainServiceDescription we examine.
member.param: The entity type whose derived types are needed.
member.returns: The collection of derived types. It may be empty.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.DataContractSurrogateGenerator
member.summary: Takes care of generating CLR types based on the virtual shape of an exposed type. E.g. we may be dealing with projection properties that don't physically exist on the CLR type. Because WCF doesn't know about TypeDescriptor, it won't see these virtual properties. This is why we generate CLR types that contain first-class properties. At serialization/deserialization time, the surrogate type will delegate to both the physical and virtual properties on the real exposed object.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Hosting.DataContractSurrogateGenerator.GetSurrogateType(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Type},System.Type)
member.summary: Emits a surrogate type for the specified type.
member.param: The known set of exposed types.
member.returns: The surrogate type.

member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: A description of the this type creates surrogates for.
The map of known exposed types to surrogate types. This object is passed in externally for efficiency reasons. Its contents won't change; the set is owned by this type.
The set of known surrogate types. This object is passed in externally for efficiency reasons. Its contents won't change; the set is owned by this type.
